title: Bioengineering Industrial Internship
description: Under the joint supervision of a faculty adviser and industry mentor, the student will work at or be mentored at a bioengineering industrial company to gain practical bioengineering experience, summarized in a technical report. May be taken for credit up to three times. With department approval, four units of credit may substitute for a technical elective. (P/NP grades only.) Prerequisites: consent of department and completion of all lower-division course requirements, including general-science requirement; laboratory experience. (F,W,S,Su)
